last year the subcommittee on health and environment held two days of hearings on the advertising of tobacco products
during those two days of hearings we heard an onslaught of emotional appeals about how advertising of tobacco products drives our children to smoke
those appeals were lacking in any in any factual basis however
tobacco advertising does not seek to recruit new users of tobacco product
tobacco advertising is designed to promote brand loyalty and to cause people to switch from one brand to another

tobacco advertising is no different in this respect than laundry detergent advertising both are designed to encourage users of the brand to continue to use that brand and to convince those who use other brands to switch supporters of a ban on Advertising maintained that the Supreme Court cleared the way for then advertising ban in the posadas case
nothing could be further from the truth and deciding the posadas case to the Supreme Court did not overturn the Central Hudson case
in Central Hudson the Supreme Court set out a specific framework for weighing legitimate interest in restricting commercial speech the framework involves a four-point test

whether the commercial speech in question is a lawful activity whether the government interest asserted in support of legislation is substantial whether the regulation directly advances the governmental interest asserted and I like to repeat that whether the regulation directly advances the governmental interest asserted and whether the regulation goes no further than necessary to serve
